text: There is some discussion of this feature earlier in the channel.  I could not find the docs reference.

Ok - basically my bad - the custom template is getting invoked and it was an issue with my preseed command.:blush:

I will mention that the log is a bit confusing. Just prior to the dump of the seed file in the log is a series of entries of the form: `Param <param> not defined, falling back to default value`. I made the assumption that since there was no entry for part-scheme, it wasn't being seen.

Bottom line, it would be nice for debugging purposes if the logs contained a complete dump of all parameters and values for a given run.

root.text: Sorry for the general cluelessness, but I'm having problems getting DRP to recognize a custom partitioning scheme. I've cloned the template part-scheme-default.tmpl to part-scheme-btrfs.tmpl.  After the initial boot, I edit the machine to invoke the ubuntu18 workflow and set a parameter 'part-scheme' to 'btrfs'. Machine reboots and starts installing, but does not invoke the custom template. I've turned trace on but I don't see any inidcation that DRP is looking for a value for part-scheme. Oh, and how do I add a stage to a workflow?

text: <@U7P8TES5B>  - if you turn up the logging levels on the info & preferences pages, you'll see a lot more... Probably the renderer log

text: <@U6QFVRJNB> - BootEnv, Renderer and Default Log Level were all set to trace.
